Stephen Traitz Jr., a union leader convicted of conspiracy to bribe judges and embezzle union funds, was sentenced in Federal District Court here Friday to 15 years in prison and a $50,000 fine. Mr. Traitz, the 50-year-old business manager of Local 30-30B of the Roofers Union, was convicted in November along with two sons, a son-in-law and eight former officials of the local. Eight co-defendants were given prison terms of 8 to 14 years, and three other defendants will be sentenced later.
